sen.j: 扶余豊璋（ふよ ほうしょう、扶余豐璋、生没年不詳）は百済最後の義慈王（在位：641年 - 660年）の王子。
sen.e: Buyeo Pung (years of birth and death unknown) was the prince of the last King Uija of Paekche (reign AD 641 to AD 660).
Buyeo Pung (years of birth and death unknown) was the prince of the last King Uija of Paekche (reign AD 641 to AD 660).
Buyeo Pung (years of birth and death unknown) was the prince of the last King Uija of Paekche (reign AD 641 to AD 660).

sen.j: 扶余豊璋は『日本書紀』での表記、『三国史記』では余豊璋、『旧唐書』では余豊である。
sen.e: Buyeo Pung was the transcription in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), in "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), it was Yeo Pung, while in "Jiu Tang Shu" (Old Tang History), it was Yeo Pung.
Buyeo Pung was the transcription in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), in "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), it was Yeo Pung, and in "Jiu Tang Shu" (Old Tang History), it was Yeo Pung.
Buyeo Pung was the transcription in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), in "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), it was Yeo Pung, and in "Jiu Tang Shu" (Old Tang History), it was Yeo Pung.

sen.j: 倭国滞在中、百済本国が唐・新羅に滅ぼされたため、百済を復興すべく帰国した。
sen.e: While he was staying in the old Japan, Paekche was destroyed by Tang Dynasty and Silla, he returned home to revive Paekche.
While he was staying in the old Japan, Paekche was destroyed by Tang Dynasty and Silla, so he returned home to revive Paekche.
While he was staying in the old Japan, Paekche was destroyed by Tang Dynasty and Silla, so he returned home to revive Paekche.

sen.j: 豊璋の渡来時期は『日本書紀』によれば舒明天皇3年（631年）3月である。
sen.e: The period when Pung came from overseas, according to "Nihonshoki", was AD 631 March.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Pung came from overseas, according to "Nihonshoki", in March, AD 631.
sen.cmt: The period whenは不要だと思います。
sen.e: Pung came from overseas, according to "Nihonshoki", in March, AD 631.

sen.j: が、『三国史記』百済本紀には義慈王13年（653年）倭国と通好すとあるので、この頃ではないだろうかとする説もある。
sen.e: However, in 'History of Paekche' of "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), since it was written that the relationship with Yamato (ancient Japan) was established in AD 653, it was conjectured that he might have come around this time.

However, in 'History of Paekche' of "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), since it says that the relationship with Yamato (ancient Japan) was established in AD 653, it was conjectured that he might have come around this time.

However, in 'History of Paekche' of "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), since it says that the relationship with Yamato (ancient Japan) was established in AD 653, it was conjectured that he might have come around this time.

sen.j: 『書紀』には既に孝徳天皇の650年2月15日、造営途中の難波宮で白雉改元の契機となった白雉献上の儀式に豊璋が出席している。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it was already written that on February 15 AD 650 during the rule of Emperor Kotoku, Pung attended the ceremony of the white pheasant presentation (which was the start of changing name of an era) in Naniwanomiya Palace under construction.

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it was already written that on February 15 AD 650 during the rule of Emperor Kotoku, Pung attended the ceremony of the white pheasant presentation (which was the start of changing name of an era) in Naniwanomiya Palace that was under construction.

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it was already written that on February 15 AD 650 during the rule of Emperor Kotoku, Pung attended the ceremony of the white pheasant presentation (which was the start of changing name of an era) in Naniwanomiya Palace that was under construction.

sen.j: 豊璋は日本と百済の同盟を担保する人質ではあったが、日本側は太安万侶の一族多蒋敷の妹を豊璋に娶わせるなど、待遇は賓客扱いであり決して悪くはなかった。
sen.e: Though Pung was a hostage who mortgages the alliance of Paekche with Japan, Pung was treated as an honored guest, so it was not bad.
Though Pung was a hostage who mortgages the alliance of Paekche with Japan, Pung was treated as an honored guest, so it was not bad.
Though Pung was a hostage who mortgages the alliance of Paekche with Japan, Pung was treated as an honored guest, so it was not bad.

sen.j: 660年、唐・新羅の連合軍が急に百済を滅ぼしたという知らせが届いた。
sen.e: In AD 660, the news that Allied Forces of Tang Dynasty and Silla Kingdom suddenly destroyed Paekche came.
In AD 660, news reached that said the Allied Forces of Tang Dynasty and Silla Kingdom suddenly destroyed Paekche.
In AD 660, news reached that said the Allied Forces of Tang Dynasty and Silla Kingdom suddenly destroyed Paekche.

sen.j: 唐軍は百済征服後、大部分が引き上げ、1万の駐留軍が残るだけであるので、百済の佐平・鬼室福信らが百済を復興すべく反乱を起こしたという知らせも来た。
sen.e: After the Tang army conquered Paekche, the majority returned country with only a stationed troop of 10,000 soldiers remained, and therefore a note from Fukushin Kishitsu and others, who was the Sahira (highest officer in Paekche) also came, saying that they had raised a revolt.

After the Tang army conquered Paekche, the majority returned leaving only a stationed troop of 10,000 soldiers, and therefore a note from Fukushin Kishitsu and others, who was the Sahira (highest officer in Paekche) also came, saying that they had raised a revolt.
sen.cmt: country削除しました。Leavingにしました。
sen.e: After the Tang army conquered Paekche, the majority returned leaving only a stationed troop of 10,000 soldiers, and therefore a note from Fukushin Kishitsu and others, who was the Sahira (highest officer in Paekche) also came, saying that they had raised a revolt.

sen.j: 当時、倭国の実権を掌握していた中大兄王（後の天智天皇）は倭国の総力を挙げて百済復興を支援することを決定、都を筑紫朝倉宮に移動させた。
sen.e: At that time, King Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who seized the real power in Yamato (ancient Japan), decided to support revival of the Paekche by enumerating all the effort in Yamato, and moved the capital to Chikushi Asakura Palace.

At that time, King Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who seized the real power in Yamato (ancient Japan), decided to support revival of the Paekche by enumerating all the effort in Yamato, and moved the capital to Chikushi Asakura Palace.

At that time, King Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who seized the real power in Yamato (ancient Japan), decided to support revival of the Paekche by enumerating all the effort in Yamato, and moved the capital to Chikushi Asakura Palace.

sen.j: 662年5月、倭国は豊璋に狭井檳榔、秦田来津の二将率いる兵5000と軍船170艘を添えて百済へと遣わした。
sen.e: In May AD 662, Yamato affixed 5000 soldiers led by two generals Sai Binro and HATA no Takutsu, and 170 military ships to Pung and dispatched him to Paekche.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In May AD 662, Yamato affixed 5000 soldiers, led by two generals Sai Binro and HATA no Takutsu, and 170 military ships to Pung and dispatched him to Paekche.
In May AD 662, Yamato affixed 5000 soldiers, led by two generals Sai Binro and HATA no Takutsu, and 170 military ships to Pung and dispatched him to Paekche.

sen.j: 豊璋は約30年ぶりとなる帰国を果たした。
sen.e: Thus Pung became able to return country after an interval of about 30 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus Pung became able to return country after about 30 years.
sen.cmt: an interval ofは不要だと思います。
sen.e: Thus Pung became able to return country after about 30 years.

sen.j: 豊璋と倭軍は鬼室福信と合流し、豊璋は百済王に推戴されたが、次第に実権を握る鬼室福信との確執が生まれた。
sen.e: Pung and the Yamato army joined Fukushin Kishitsu, Pung was recommended as King of Paekche, but later, the discord with Fukushin Kishitsu who seized the real power gradually arose.
Pung and the Yamato army joined Fukushin Kishitsu, Pung was recommended as King of Paekche, but later, the discord with Fukushin Kishitsu who seized the real power gradually arose.
Pung and the Yamato army joined Fukushin Kishitsu, Pung was recommended as King of Paekche, but later, the discord with Fukushin Kishitsu who seized the real power gradually arose.

sen.j: 663年6月、豊璋はついに鬼室福信を殺害した。
sen.e: In June AD 663, Pung eventually murdered Fukushin Kishitsu.
In June AD 663, Pung eventually murdered Fukushin Kishitsu.
In June AD 663, Pung eventually murdered Fukushin Kishitsu.

sen.j: しかしこの暴挙により百済復興軍は著しく弱体化し、唐・新羅軍の侵攻を招くことになった。
sen.e: However, because of this violent act, Paekche's revival army remarkably weakened and caused the Tang-Silla army to invade.
However, because of this violent act, Paekche's revival army remarkably weakened and caused the Tang-Silla army to invade.
However, because of this violent act, Paekche's revival army remarkably weakened and caused the Tang-Silla army to invade.

sen.j: 豊璋は周留城に籠城して倭国の援軍を待った。
sen.e: Pung was besieged to Suru-jo Castle, waited for the reinforcement army of Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Pung was besieged to Suru-jo Castle, waited for the reinforcement army of Yamato.
Pung was besieged to Suru-jo Castle, waited for the reinforcement army of Yamato.

sen.j: しかし、8月13日、城兵を見捨てて脱出し、倭国の援軍に合流した。
sen.e: However, on August 13, he escaped and left the castle soldiers in the lurch, and joined reinforcement army of Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, on August 13, he escaped and left the castle soldiers in the lurch, and joined reinforcement army of Yamato.
However, on August 13, he escaped and left the castle soldiers in the lurch, and joined reinforcement army of Yamato.

sen.j: やがて唐本国から劉仁軌の率いる7000名の救援部隊が到着した。
sen.e: Before long, the rescue force of 7000 people led by RYU Jin Ki from the Tang Dynasty arrived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Before long, the rescue force of 7000 people, led by RYU Jin Ki from the Tang Dynasty, arrived.
Before long, the rescue force of 7000 people, led by RYU Jin Ki from the Tang Dynasty, arrived.

sen.j: 8月27、28日の両日、倭国水軍と白村江（韓国では「白江」、「白馬江」ともいう）で衝突した。
sen.e: Both days of August 27, 28, they confronted with Yamato's sea warriors in Baekgang River (also called White River or White Horse River in Korea).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On both days of August 27, 28, they confronted with Yamato's sea warriors in Baekgang River (also called White River or White Horse River in Korea).
On both days of August 27, 28, they confronted with Yamato's sea warriors in Baekgang River (also called White River or White Horse River in Korea).

sen.j: その結果、倭国・百済連合軍が大敗した。
sen.e: As a result, the union army of Yamato and Paekche suffered a crushing defeat.
As a result, the union army of Yamato and Paekche suffered a crushing defeat.
As a result, the union army of Yamato and Paekche suffered a crushing defeat.

sen.j: いわゆる白村江の戦いである。
sen.e: It was called Battle of Hakusukinoe.
It was called the Battle of Hakusukinoe.
It was called the Battle of Hakusukinoe.

sen.j: 豊璋は数人の従者と共に高句麗に逃れた。
sen.e: Pung escaped in Goguryeo with several attendants.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Pung escaped in Goguryeo with several attendants.
Pung escaped in Goguryeo with several attendants.

sen.j: しかし、その高句麗も内紛に付け込まれて668年唐に滅ぼされた。
sen.e: However, Goguryeo also was involved in internal troubles and it was destroyed in AD 668 by Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Goguryeo also was involved in internal troubles and it was destroyed in AD 668 by the Tang Dynasty.
However, Goguryeo also was involved in internal troubles and it was destroyed in AD 668 by the Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 豊璋は高句麗王族らとともに唐の都に連行された。
sen.e: Pung, with royal families of Goguryeo, was taken to the capital in Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Pung, with royal families of Goguryeo, was taken to the capital in Tang Dynasty.
Pung, with royal families of Goguryeo, was taken to the capital in Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 高句麗王らは許されて唐の官爵を授けられた。
sen.e: The king of Goguryeo and others were forgiven and granted official ranks in Tang.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The king of Goguryeo and others were forgiven and granted official ranks in Tang.
The king of Goguryeo and others were forgiven and granted official ranks in Tang.

sen.j: しかし、豊璋は許されず、嶺南（中国南部）地方に流刑にされた。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: But Pung was not forgiven and was banished to Reinan region (southern China).
But Pung was not forgiven and was banished to Reinan region (southern China).

sen.j: 豊璋の弟については、『日本書紀』によれば百済王善光（『続日本紀』では禪廣）といい日本に渡来人として滞在した。
sen.e: About the younger brother of Pung, according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), he was called Paekche King Zenko (different kanji characters of Zenko in "Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicle of Japan Continued]), came from overseas to Japan and stayed here.

About the younger brother of Pung, according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), he was called Paekche King Zenko (different kanji characters of Zenko in "Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicles of Japan Continued]), came from overseas to Japan and stayed here.

About the younger brother of Pung, according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), he was called Paekche King Zenko (different kanji characters of Zenko in "Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicles of Japan Continued]), came from overseas to Japan and stayed here.

sen.j: その子孫が持統天皇から百済王氏（くだらのこにきし）のカバネを賜って百済の王統を伝えた。
sen.e: The descendants were given kabane (hereditary title) of Paekche clan from Emperor Jito, and handed down the royal line of Paekche.
The descendants were given kabane (hereditary title) of Paekche clan from Emperor Jito, and handed down the royal line of Paekche.
The descendants were given kabane (hereditary title) of Paekche clan from Emperor Jito, and handed down the royal line of Paekche.

sen.j: 『万葉集』巻一第五番、六番に「軍王」と称する人物が舒明天皇の行幸に供奉した際に作った和歌が収録されている。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" Volume 1, chapters 5 and 6, there is a Japanese poem composed by a person called Guno who presented it while he was accompanying the Imperial Progress of Emperor Jomei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" Volume 1, chapters 5 and 6, there is a Japanese poem composed by a person called Guno who presented it while he was accompanying the Imperial Progress of Emperor Jomei.
In "Manyoshu" Volume 1, chapters 5 and 6, there is a Japanese poem composed by a person called Guno who presented it while he was accompanying the Imperial Progress of Emperor Jomei.

sen.j: しかし、この「軍王」を「こにきしのおおきみ」と読み、豊璋のことではないかと見る説がある。
sen.e: However, there is a theory saying that this Guno who was was read "konikishi no Ookimi" may be Pung.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there is a theory saying that this Guno who was was read "konikishi no Ookimi" may be Pung.
However, there is a theory saying that this Guno who was was read "konikishi no Ookimi" may be Pung.
